page.title: 10Buses Vital to Emborough
page.content: Being in an agricultural area, the people of Emborough live mainly on farms and therefore often have their own transport. This is necessary as the only bus service detours the village. However a walk of a few minutes brings would be travellers within range of the route. The service is an hourly one between Wells and Bath. Having no local shops within walking distance can be awkward, especially for old people and mothers with young children if they are without the use of a car. The buses theefore are a vital link and despite the relatively low number of people using them, they must be maintained. People living on the outer edges of our square, however, have access to shops at Chewton Mendip and Chilcompton.
